analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** BEARISH with MEDIUM-HIGH conviction. Sources converge on technical deterioration and capital outflows overriding bullish narratives, though Fed policy and AI themes provide structural support for swing timeframes.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) Technical breakdown momentum - Bitcoin below 50-week MA, QQQ losing gap support, sustained crypto ETF outflows. (2) Earnings guidance pressure vs. AI productivity narratives - Enterprise software and fintech cuts colliding with long-term efficiency tailwinds. (3) Labor market inflection point - Employment data driving Fed dovish pivot, but disagreement on whether slowdown remains manageable or accelerates into deleveraging.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($674.45): Call Wall $681 (17k OI, active resistance), Put Wall $670 (9k OI, active support). Max Pain $670. Near resistance: $680 (16k OI), $685 (16k OI). Near support: $674 (8k OI), $665 (7k OI). QQQ ($604.32): Call Wall $615 (13k OI, active resistance), Put Wall $595 (7k OI, active support). Max Pain $625. Near resistance: $613 (11k OI), $610 (10k OI). Near support: $600 (6k OI), $603 (5k OI). Twitter mentions: QQQ 610 gap-up support failure, NVDA weakness below $174, Oracle below $181.50. Bitcoin at $10K target level per McGlone warning.
key_themes: Technical breakdown momentum and crypto ETF outflows
Enterprise earnings guidance cuts vs AI productivity narratives
Labor market deterioration driving Fed dovish pivot
Dealer gamma resistance creating bearish positioning
Regulatory tightening pressures on tech and fintech
risk_factors: Accelerating unemployment above 5% triggering deleveraging before Fed cuts provide support
Sustained crypto ETF outflows signaling broader risk-off capital rotation
Enterprise software earnings validating sector-wide demand weakness beyond company-specific issues
Geopolitical escalation (Taiwan, Russia-Ukraine) amplifying dollar strength and risk-off sentiment
Dealer gamma resistance at SPY $681 and QQQ $615 capping upside momentum
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Support $674 (8k OI active), $670 put wall. Resistance $680 (16k OI), $681 call wall. QQQ: Support $603 (5k OI active), $600 (6k OI). Resistance $610 (10k OI), $613 (11k OI). Downside bias into max pain zones.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Key support $670 max pain (9k OI put wall), breakdown target $665 (7k OI). Resistance $681 call wall (17k OI), $685 (16k OI). QQQ: Critical support $600 (6k OI), breakdown opens $595 put wall (7k OI). Resistance $610 gap level, $613 (11k OI), $615 call wall (13k OI). NVDA: $155 Jan put strike with unusual activity per Twitter. Watch for stabilization in crypto ETF flows as reversal signal.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
